{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient presents with renal failure, mild bone pains for 7 years, osteolytic lesions on X-ray pelvis, M spike on serum electrophoresis, rouleaux formation of RBCs, and aberrant antigen expression in plasma cells. The combination of these features suggests a diagnosis of multiple myeloma, as it is a type of hematological malignancy that can cause renal failure, bone pain, and lytic lesions on X-ray.", "answer_choice": "A"}
